intro: Primula lactea, commonly known as the milk primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The milk primrose is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its delicate floral display.
